Articles.Content:
I finally upgraded Windows to 64 bit! (I was 12 when I built my computer, I accidentally ordered windows off of a 32 bit machine... 12 year olds make mistakes ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif) lel)

So, now I'm back to KSP! I can enjoy the privilege of mods and much less crashes!

KSP was the first thing I've installed in terms of games. Then Goat Sim. 2 requirements for me lol

I'd like to thank Squad for making a great game that was enough by itself to buy a backup drive and Windows 8.1 again. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Best of luck Naten! May the goat sim and KSP be with you...

> 
> So, now I'm back to KSP! I can enjoy the privilege of mods and much less crashes!

The 64bit client for Windows is extremely unstable. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Career in 0.90.0 is broken if you use the x64 executable by the way, so you have to use the 32bit exe, sandbox is not affected though.

Oh yeah, definitely sticking to the x86 exe for now ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> The 64bit client for Windows is extremely unstable. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Um...

well, without RAM limits for the OS itself, 64x running x86 ksp performs better than x86 running x86 ksp.
